thread.title: Swipe Elite 3 with 5-inch HD display and VoLTE launched for Rs 5,499
thread.title_full: Swipe Elite 3 with 5-inch HD display and VoLTE launched for Rs 5,499

title: Swipe Elite 3 with 5-inch HD display and VoLTE launched for Rs 5,499
text:
Swipe Elite 3 with 5-inch HD display and VoLTE launched for Rs... Swipe Elite 3 with 5-inch HD display and VoLTE launched for Rs 5,499 By - February 20, 2017 “The Elite 3 is an entry-level offering with 16GB of storage, 8MP/5MP cameras and a 2,500mAh battery” 
Swipe recently launched the Konnect Star , a budget 4-incher with 4G and VoLTE for Rs 3,799. Today, the company has added yet another budget smartphone to its portfolio with the launch of the Swipe Elite 3. Similar to the Konnect Star, the Elite 3 is also an entry-level offering with dual-SIM slots, 4G and VoLTE (voice over LTE) support. 
As for the other specs, the Swipe Elite 3 features a 5-inch HD IPS display, and boots Android 6.0 Marshmallow. The phone is powered by a 1.3GHz quad-core Spreadtrum processor, mated to 2GB of RAM and Mali 400 graphics. It comes with 16GB of internal storage, further expandable up to 32GB by inserting a microSD card. 
The camera department on the Elite 3 includes an 8-megapixel primary shooter with an LED flash and a 5-megapixel secondary snapper. The phone comes with Wi-Fi, Bluetooth 4.0 and GPS, apart from 4G and VoLTE connectivity options. A 2,500mAh battery keeps the handset running. 
The Swipe Elite 3 has been priced at Rs 5,499, and will be available exclusively on Flipkart starting tomorrow. The phone is being offered in space grey and champagne gold hues.
